messages.subject: Re: Digest Number 1200
messages.msgSnippet: I can t help it. I ve tried to stop myself...but... We are the world! We are the children! We are the ones that make a better day So let s start living.... Not
messages.messageBody:
I can't help it. I've tried to stop myself...but...

We are the world!
We are the children!
We are the ones that make a better day
So let's start living....

Not even sure I got the words right, but it had to be said...

love, Valerie

neighbor's
> >words) and, really, I'm too shy to do any good in that kind of
> >situation. I nominate Sandra and Helen and ... Sorry, I'm getting
> >carried away.
>
> Ah, Melanie, I appreciate the vote of confidence, but I'd rather
chat
> with all you good folks who *Get It* than with someone who doesn't -

> and probably never will - understand the importance of
homeschooling.
> Er... make that unschooling. <g>
>
> Helen

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1200
messages.msgSnippet: ... Ah, Melanie, I appreciate the vote of confidence, but I d rather chat with all you good folks who *Get It* than with someone who doesn t - and probably
messages.messageBody:
At 7:25 PM +0000 5/4/01, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com wrote:
>Message: 6
> Date: Fri, 04 May 2001 13:38:01 -0000
> From: vouget@...
>Subject: Re:Re: Expert advice
>
>That's why she's got to get some of you to go with her to Oprah. I
>would, but my kids are young so they "don't count yet" (my neighbor's
>words) and, really, I'm too shy to do any good in that kind of
>situation. I nominate Sandra and Helen and ... Sorry, I'm getting
>carried away.

Ah, Melanie, I appreciate the vote of confidence, but I'd rather chat
with all you good folks who *Get It* than with someone who doesn't -
and probably never will - understand the importance of homeschooling.
Er... make that unschooling. <g>

Helen
